alert.note: Alert for Dearborn (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 3:05PM EST until March 11 at 11:37PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Southeast Indiana, Northern Kentucky and Ohio, including the following counties, in Indiana, Dearborn, Franklin IN, Ohio, Ripley and Switzerland. In Northern Kentucky, Boone, Campbell and Kenton. In Ohio, Butler, Clark, Clermont, Clinton, Greene, Hamilton, Montgomery and Warren. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 305 PM EST, radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Cincinnati, Dayton, Hamilton, Springfield, Kettering, Middletown, Beavercreek, Fairfield, Covington, Huber Heights, Fairborn, Mason, Florence, Xenia, Independence, Trotwood, Oxford, Miamisburg, Lebanon and Norwood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
